title: Virtual Member Lecture: Cosmoscapes—Ink Paintings by Tai Xiangzhou
title_display: Virtual Member Lecture: Cosmoscapes—Ink Paintings by Tai Xiangzhou
hero_caption: Tai Xiangzhou. Mountain of Heaven, 2014. Collection of Tai Xiangzhou.
short_description: Reflecting on the exhibition Cosmoscapes: Ink Paintings by Tai Xiangzhou, Colin Mackenzie, curator of Chinese art, discusses how Tai's works reveal a non-Western classical worldview and assert its relevance in our increasingly globalized age, followed by a conversation between Tao Wang, Pritzker Chair of Arts of Asia and curator of Chinese art, and the artist.
description:
Artist Tai Xiangzhou and Tao Wang, Pritzker Chair of the Arts of Asia, curator of Chinese art, and executive director of initiatives in Asia, discuss how Tai's works reveal a non-Western classical worldview and assert its relevance in our increasingly globalized age.

Cosmoscapes: Ink Paintings by Tai Xiangzhou brings together 13 works by the acclaimed artist—including horizontal and vertical scrolls, screens, and album leaves drawn from the artist’s own collection and others in the United States—that together dissolve and even transcend distinctions between the traditional and the innovative. Tai’s extraordinary paintings are not only visual but also visionary, leading the viewer into imaginary realms and inspiring wonder toward the unknown universe.

We recommend using a laptop or desktop computer, and downloading the latest version of Zoom to enjoy this program.

If you have any questions about virtual programming, please reach out to museum-programs@artic.edu.

Closed captioning will be available for this program. For questions related to accessibility accommodations, please email access@artic.edu.
